alert.note: Alert for Lawrence; Martin (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 31 at 11:59AM EDT until April 03 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... East Fork White River near Bedford and at Shoals. White River at Hazleton. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana... East Fork White River near Rivervale and at Williams. White River at Edwardsport and at Petersburg. .Widespread lowland flooding continues along the East Fork White River from Rivervale to Shoals....and along the White River at Edwardsport to Hazleton. Moderate flooding is occurring on the White River...at Petersburg...with brief moderate flooding possible at Hazleton Saturday. Moderate flooding is expected to end on the White River by Sunday. The East Fork White River has crested and is forecast to continue falling...while the crest on the White River will slowly pass Petersburg late today. Minor flooding is expected to end on the East Fork White River early next week...and on the White River...on Sunday at Edwardsport...while continuing at downriver points through next week. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...East Fork White River near Bedford. * WHEN...Until early Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Limited parking at Bedford Boat Club. Flood waters cover much of the parking lot and are too deep to drive in. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM EDT Friday the stage was 24.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 AM EDT Friday was 24.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Monday morning and continue falling to 9.8 feet Monday, April 10. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated late this evening.
